Head, Investment Banking Job at Westfield Consulting Limited




        
    

        
        Westfield Consulting was founded in January 2012, by a team of Nigerians with over 45 years of cumulative work experience in management and consultancy. Westfield Consulting is a provider of Human Resource and Strategic Management Services.

Our focus on innovation and excellence in service delivery has made us a first choice to our growing clientele in various sectors. We have successfully achieved a positive work force attitude, while engineering a more motivated and committed workforce for our clients with notable results Our results provide a testament about the quality of our services. 70% of our business is repeat business.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head, Investment Banking
Job Location: Lagos 
Report to: Chief Executive Officer
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
Portfolio Management:


	Manage and oversee investment portfolios, ensuring optimal asset allocation and performance.
	Conduct regular portfolio reviews and rebalancing to meet investment objectives.


Investment Analysis:


	Perform in-depth analysis of potential investment opportunities, including equities, fixed income, and alternative investments.
	Utilize financial models and valuation techniques to assess investment risks and returns.


Strategy Development:


	Develop and implement investment strategies that align with the organization's goals and risk tolerance.
	Stay updated on market trends, economic conditions, and regulatory changes affecting the Nigerian capital market.
	Develop customized investment solutions for clients based on their objectives and risk profiles.


Regulatory Compliance:


	Ensure compliance with all regulatory requirements, including SEC regulations.
	Prepare regulatory reports as required.


Reporting:


	Prepare and present detailed investment reports to the management team and clients.
	Communicate investment performance, strategies, and market outlook effectively.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting, or a related field.
	Advanced degrees (e.g. ICAN, ACCA) are highly desirable.


Professional Experience:


	Minimum of 7– 10 years of investment management experience within the Nigerian capital market.
	Demonstrable experience in managing investment portfolios, including equities, fixed income, and alternative investments such as Commodities.
	Ability to make informed investment decisions and manage risks effectively.
	Understanding of regulatory requirements and compliance in the Nigerian capital market.
	Strong analytical, quantitative, and decision-making skills.
	Excellent communication and presentation abilities.
	High ethical standards and integrity.

Very Attractive.

	The Network Engineer will be responsible for implementing, managing and supporting our network systems to ensure reliable connectivity and optimal performance.

	First Degree or equivalent in relevance to computer science
	Minimum of 2 - 3 years of experience in the role

	This Job role is for residents in Abuja.

Network Engineer Job at Resource Consulting Limited




        
    

        
        At Resource Consulting Limited, we believe that people are the best asset in any business system. To help organizations achieve productivity through a competent workforce, RCL works closely with our clients to provide the right business solutions to meet clients’ leadership training, recruitment, culture, and engagement needs. We employ the best professionals with the right expertise, experience and knowledge to ensure quality service

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Network Engineer

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	The Network Engineer will be responsible for implementing, managing and supporting our network systems to ensure reliable connectivity and optimal performance.
	You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance our network infrastructure, troubleshoot issues, and implement security measures.


Key Responsibilities


	Design and configure network infrastructure, including routers, switches, firewalls, and other networking equipment.
	Monitor network performance and troubleshoot connectivity issues to ensure high availability.
	Implement and manage network security protocols to protect sensitive data and prevent unauthorized access.
	Collaborate with IT teams to support server and application performance through effective network management.
	Network Design & Implementation: Design, implement, and optimize robust network architectures that meet organizational needs
	Troubleshooting: Identify, diagnose, and resolve network issues to maintain seamless connectivity.
	Stay Updated: Keep abreast of emerging technologies and industry trends to recommend enhancements
	Conduct regular network assessments and recommend improvements or upgrades.
	Document network configurations, procedures, and policies for compliance and training purposes.
	Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies to drive innovation within the organization.
	Provide technical support and training to staff as needed.


Qualifications


	First Degree or equivalent in relevance to computer science
	Minimum of 2 - 3 years of experience in the role
	Strong knowledge of networking protocols (TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, VPN, etc.).
	Experience with network monitoring and management tools.
	Familiarity with firewalls, VPNs, and security solutions.
	Proficient in the use of applications
	Experience with Linux and Windows Server OS
	This Job role is for residents in Abuja.


Remuneration


	N200,000 - N250,000 (Net)
	Transport Allowance – N20,000
	Data Allowance – N6,000
	Feeding is provided.


Method of Application

  "description": "Zibac Consulting - Our client is a luxury Real Estate company and their mission is to redefine luxury real estates through exceptional service, exclusive properties, and tailored experiences that delight and satisfy discerning clients. With integrity, innovation, and personalized attention as our core values, we ensure every interaction and campaign reflects our brand&rsquo;s elegance and excellence.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Digital Marketer
Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)

Job Overview


	We are looking for a creative and analytical Digital Marketer with 3&ndash;6 years of experience to drive the company&rsquo;s digital presence, lead generation efforts, and brand visibility.
	The ideal candidate understands both strategy and execution, and is passionate about reaching affluent audiences through data-driven, high-end digital campaigns.


Key Responsibilities
Digital Strategy &amp; Planning:


	Develop and execute digital marketing strategies to drive qualified leads and promote luxury property listings.
	Design and implement digital campaigns aligned with sales goals and seasonal trends in the real estate market.
	Plan, create, and manage content calendars for multiple platforms including Instagram, LinkedIn, Facebook, and YouTube.


Content Creation &amp; Brand Management:


	Craft compelling content (copy, video scripts, ads) that speaks to high-net-worth individuals and corporate clients.
	Oversee visual storytelling, property showcases, and virtual tours to maintain a polished and aspirational brand image.
	Ensure all digital content reflects the sophistication and exclusivity of the company&rsquo;s brand.


Performance Marketing &amp; Analytics:


	Plan and manage paid ad campaigns (Google Ads, Facebook/Instagram Ads) for lead generation and retargeting.
	Monitor campaign KPIs (CTR, CPC, conversions) and optimize accordingly.
	Generate performance reports and insights using Google Analytics, Meta Business Suite, and CRM platforms.
	Conduct SEO/SEM audits and implement on-page/off-page improvements.


Marketing Automation &amp; CRM:


	Utilize CRM tools to track lead behavior and create targeted email campaigns and sales funnels.
	Segment customer databases and implement personalized campaigns to nurture leads and increase conversion.
	Support the sales team with timely insights and engagement strategies from digital interactions.


Collaboration &amp; Events:


	Work with the sales, creative, and operations teams to align campaigns with current listings, launches, or events.
	Promote company presence at real estate expos, open houses, and premium networking events online.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Marketing, Mass Communication, Digital Media, or related field.
	3&ndash;6 years of proven experience in digital marketing, preferably in luxury, real estate, hospitality, or lifestyle brands.
	Deep understanding of Abuja&rsquo;s digital audience and real estate buyer behavior.
	Hands-on experience with Google Ads, Meta Ads, SEO tools (e.g., SEMrush, Ahrefs), and email marketing platforms.
	Proficiency in content creation tools (Canva, Adobe Suite, or similar).
	Strong analytical skills and ability to turn data into actionable insights.
	Excellent communication, storytelling, and visual branding abilities


Preferred Attributes:


	Familiarity with the luxury market and HNI engagement.
	Experience in short-form video content and influencer outreach.
	Certification in Google Ads, HubSpot, or Digital Marketing is a plus.


Perks &amp; Benefits


	Competitive salary: N260,000 &ndash; N350,000 Monthly.
	Work in a high-performing and elegant brand environment
	Growth and professional development opportunities

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Procurement Officer (Solar Panel Manufacturing)",
  "description": "T.O.N Corporate Services&nbsp; -&nbsp;Our client provides businesses with a professional phone system that enables teams to manage customer calls efficiently. Their goal is to help businesses improve the quality of their customer interactions while enhancing operational efficiency.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Procurement Officer (Solar Panel Manufacturing)

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja

Job Description


	We are seeking a detail-oriented and skilled Procurement Officer to manage sourcing, negotiation, and purchasing of quality raw materials, components and services in a cost-effective and timely manner.
	This role ideal candidate will have experience in supply chain management, negotiation, vendor relations and a solid understanding of the renewable energy and manufacturing sector.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify and develop new suppliers.
	Source, evaluate, and manage suppliers of raw materials and production equipment.
	Ensure timely procurement of materials to avoid production delays.
	Negotiate contracts, pricing, and payment terms with suppliers and service providers.
	Monitor inventory levels and place orders as needed in collaboration with the production and inventory teams.
	Ensure compliance with company procurement policies and quality standards.
	Maintain accurate procurement records and update the procurement database regularly.
	Analyze market trends to forecast demand and minimize purchasing costs.
	Assist in identifying cost-saving opportunities and alternative suppliers.
	Collaborate with technical and engineering teams to understand product specifications and procurement requirements.
	Coordinate with logistics and warehousing teams to ensure timely delivery and proper storage of materials.


Requirements


	Bachelor or Master&rsquo;s degree in Supply Chain Management, Procurement, Engineering or a related field.
	5+ years of procurement experience (manufacturing/renewable energy preferred)
	Proven working experience as a procurement officer or head of procurement or supply chain.
	Strong knowledge of supply chain principles and procurement best practices.
	Hands on experience in handling supply contracts both at local, regional and global levels.
	Excellent negotiation, communication and vendor management skills
	Analytical and problem-solving skills
	Familiarity with solar panel materials and industry trends.
	Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple priorities.
	Ability to be creative and innovative in finding solutions and negotiating strategies.
	Ability to communicate with a diverse audience at various levels and all countries and cultures within the organization.
	Proficient in utilizing E-sourcing platforms.


Benefits


	Competitive salary.
	Flexible work arrangements
	Performance-based bonuses

Procurement Officer (Solar Panel Manufacturing) Job at T.O.N Corporate Services




        
    

        
        T.O.N Corporate Services  - Our client provides businesses with a professional phone system that enables teams to manage customer calls efficiently. Their goal is to help businesses improve the quality of their customer interactions while enhancing operational efficiency.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Officer (Solar Panel Manufacturing)

Job Location: Abuja

Job Description
     

            
    




	We are seeking a detail-oriented and skilled Procurement Officer to manage sourcing, negotiation, and purchasing of quality raw materials, components and services in a cost-effective and timely manner.
	This role ideal candidate will have experience in supply chain management, negotiation, vendor relations and a solid understanding of the renewable energy and manufacturing sector.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify and develop new suppliers.
	Source, evaluate, and manage suppliers of raw materials and production equipment.
	Ensure timely procurement of materials to avoid production delays.
	Negotiate contracts, pricing, and payment terms with suppliers and service providers.
	Monitor inventory levels and place orders as needed in collaboration with the production and inventory teams.
	Ensure compliance with company procurement policies and quality standards.
	Maintain accurate procurement records and update the procurement database regularly.
	Analyze market trends to forecast demand and minimize purchasing costs.
	Assist in identifying cost-saving opportunities and alternative suppliers.
	Collaborate with technical and engineering teams to understand product specifications and procurement requirements.
	Coordinate with logistics and warehousing teams to ensure timely delivery and proper storage of materials.


Requirements


	Bachelor or Master’s degree in Supply Chain Management, Procurement, Engineering or a related field.
	5+ years of procurement experience (manufacturing/renewable energy preferred)
	Proven working experience as a procurement officer or head of procurement or supply chain.
	Strong knowledge of supply chain principles and procurement best practices.
	Hands on experience in handling supply contracts both at local, regional and global levels.
	Excellent negotiation, communication and vendor management skills
	Analytical and problem-solving skills
	Familiarity with solar panel materials and industry trends.
	Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple priorities.
	Ability to be creative and innovative in finding solutions and negotiating strategies.
	Ability to communicate with a diverse audience at various levels and all countries and cultures within the organization.
	Proficient in utilizing E-sourcing platforms.


Benefits


	Competitive salary.
	Flexible work arrangements
	Performance-based bonuses
	Opportunity to grow with a dynamic and visionary team.
